properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Pioneer Bay, St Helier, The Gurdies, Grantville, Jam Jerrup, Lang Lang, Woodleigh
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Grantville, Jam Jerrup, Lang Lang, Pioneer Bay, St Helier, The Gurdies, Woodleigh. 

  • There is a bushfire at The Gurdies that is under control.
  • Firefighters continue to monitor this fire.
  • This Community Information message replaces the Advice message issued on 26 December at 11:40am.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 28/12/2024 09:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: The Gurdies
Issue Date: Friday 27 December 2024, 09:14 am
Next Update: Saturday 28 December 2024, 09:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35451/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Grantville, Jam Jerrup, Lang Lang, Pioneer Bay, St Helier, The Gurdies, Woodleigh. 

- There is a bushfire at The Gurdies that is under control.
- Firefighters continue to monitor this fire.
- This Community Information message replaces the Advice message issued on 26 December at 11:40am.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Calivil .

  • There is a haystack fire at Calivil Mail Rd, Calivil. 
  • Haystack fires are not likely to spread into grassland but do generate a lot of smoke.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by the Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to cal VicEmergency
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - GRASS FIRE - Stay Informed

Issue Date: Friday 27 December 2024, 07:46 am
Next Update: Sunday 29 December 2024, 07:50 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35450/moreinfo

This Community Information is being issued for Calivil .

- There is a haystack fire at Calivil Mail Rd, Calivil. 
- Haystack fires are not likely to spread into grassland but do generate a lot of smoke.
- Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Cheshunt, Myrrhee, Whitlands. 

  • This Community Information replaces the Advice message issued at 7:03am Friday 27 December.
  • There is a bushfire at 9 kilometres south west of Whitfield that is under control.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 28/12/2024 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35481/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Cheshunt, Myrrhee, Whitlands. 

- This Community Information replaces the Advice message issued at 7:03am Friday 27 December.
- There is a bushfire at 9 kilometres south west of Whitfield that is under control.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Halls Gap and Pomonal. 

This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 7.06am 26 December 2024.

Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Park Victoria website.  No access is permitted to the National Park.

Residents only are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. 
Avoid standing, parking and travelling in fire affected areas. Firefighters are working to complete hazardous tree assessments. 

The bushfire is still not yet under control, the spread of the bushfire has slowed for now.  Today there has been active fire in the Silverband Road area. The winds are expected to be west-south-westerly during coming days. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. 

Community Meetings are being planned for Pomonal and Halls Gap on Sunday 29th December, monitor VicEmergency- Grampians for specific details. 

The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do:  
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family. 

Recovery and Resilience 
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan.

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. Remember to: 
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area or Stawell or Ararat.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. 
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous after a fire and during high winds. 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit Better Health website.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.   

The next update is expected by 28/12/2024 07:10 pm or as the situation changes.   

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Threat is Reduced - Monitor Conditions Incident Location: Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing and Halls Gap Issue Date: Friday 27 December 2024, 07:06 pm Next Update: Saturday 28 December 2024, 07:10 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35480/moreinfo This Watch and Act message is being issued for Halls Gap and Pomonal. This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 7.06am 26 December 2024. Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Park Victoria website. No access is permitted to the National Park. Residents only are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. Avoid standing, parking and travelling in fire affected areas. Firefighters are working to complete hazardous tree assessments. The bushfire is still not yet under control, the spread of the bushfire has slowed for now. Today there has been active fire in the Silverband Road area. The winds are expected to be west-south-westerly during coming days. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. Community Meetings are being planned for Pomonal and Halls Gap on Sunday 29th December, monitor VicEmergency- Grampians for specific details. The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Grampians, Mirranatwa and Victoria Valley.

  • This Watch and Act replaces Watch and Act issued at 4.21pm, 27 December 2024. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.    
  • Winds are expected to be west-south-westerly over the coming days. 
  • The bushfire in Grampians National Park is travelling in a easterly direction. 
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft will remain in the area.  

Community Meetings are being planned for Mirranatwa and Dunkeld on Saturday 28th December, monitor VicEmergency- Grampians for specific details. 
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Recovery and Resilience
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone),and reviewing your personal emergency plan. 

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
  • Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit Better Health website. 
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can fall across roads and cause dangerous driving conditions.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the  Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park Website.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 28/12/2024 06:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Community Meetings are being planned for Mirranatwa and Dunkeld on Saturday 28th December, monitor VicEmergency- Grampians for specific details. The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: eastern side of the Grampians National Park from Moyston to Dunkeld, including Willaura
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for eastern side of the Grampians National Park from from Moyston to Dunkeld, including Willaura. 

This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 3.53pm Friday 27 December 2024.  

Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Parks Victoria website.   No access is permitted to the National Park.

  • Residents only are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. 
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous avoid standing, parking and travelling in fire affected areas. 
  • Firefighters are working to complete hazardous tree assessments.   
  • Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. 

The bushfire at Grampians National Park is not yet under control.   The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now.  Today there has been active fire in the Silverband Road. Winds are expected to be west-south-westerly over the coming days. The fire situation can change at any time,  you must monitor conditions and be ready to act. 

Community Meetings 
A meeting will be held in Moyston on Saturday 28th December at the Moyston Recreation Reserve, 2 Moyston-Great Western Road starting at 7.00pm

Further Community Meetings are planned for Sunday in Pomonal and Halls Gap, monitor VicEmergency- Grampians for specific details.  


The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do:  
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family. 
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. Remember to: 
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area. 

Relief Centres remain open: 
Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre, 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Register your attendance at Ararat Relief centre via this link.  
  • Companion animals are welcome, but must remain on a lead at all times.  Please ensure you bring any necessary items for your animals such as food, water bowl and bedding.   
Stawell - Grampians Community Health (known as "The Shacc") 22 Patrick Street, Stawell. 
  • Register your attendance at Stawell Relief Centre via this link. 
  • Pets are welcome, please ensure they are on a lead at all times.    

Recovery and Resilience 
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.   

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone),and reviewing your personal emergency plan. 

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
Impacts in your area: 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Fire fighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website. 
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.   

The next update is expected by 28/12/2024 07:00 pm or as the situation changes.   

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Parks Victoria website. No access is permitted to the National Park. - Residents only are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. - Trees can be extremely dangerous avoid standing, parking and travelling in fire affected areas. - Firefighters are working to complete hazardous tree assessments. - Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. The bushfire at Grampians National Park is not yet under control. The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now. Today there has been active fire in the Silverband Road. Community Meetings A meeting will be held in Moyston on Saturday 28th December at the Moyston Recreation Reserve, 2 Moyston-Great Western Road starting at 7.00pm Further Community Meetings are planned for Sunday in Pomonal and Halls Gap, monitor VicEmergency- Grampians for specific details. properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Long Gully Road to College Road area, east of Mt William
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Long Gully Road to College Road are, east of Mt William. 

This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 4.10pm, 27 December 2024.

  •  It is Not Safe to Return to Long Gully Road to College Road area, east of Mt William.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park is not yet under control.  
  • The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • There are numerous trees impacted by fire in the area and it is not safe to enter.
  • Hazardous Tree assessment and treatment is being conducted in the area over coming days to allow for safe access.
  • Winds are expected to be west-south-westerly over the coming days. 
  • The bushfire in Grampians National Park is travelling in an easterly direction. 

Community Meeting are being planned for Pomonal and Halls Gap on Sunday 29th December, monitor VicEmergency-Grampians for specific details. 

If you left the area from Long Gully Road to College Road in the impacted fire area, it is Not Safe to Return. 
Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
  • Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.

Relief centres are open at:

Stawell - Grampians Community Health (known as "The Shacc") 22 Patrick Street, Stawell. 
Register your attendance at Stawell Relief Centre via this link.
Pets are welcome, please ensure they are on a lead at all times.
 
  • Register at a relief centre so your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Recovery and Resilience 
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone),and reviewing your personal emergency plan.

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
Impacts in your area:
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.

The Grampians National Park remains closed. Further information can be found at the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park Website.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 28/12/2024 04:30 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Fyans Creek, Lake Lonsdale, Mount Dryden, Wartook, Zumsteins, Glenisla, Laharum, Lake Fyans, Ledcourt, Mokepilly, Roses Gap
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Fyans Creek, Glenisla, Laharum, Lake Fyans, Lake Lonsdale, Ledcourt, Mokepilly, Mount Dryden, Roses Gap, Wartook, Zumsteins.

This Advice replaces Advice issued on 27 December 2024.

The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Park Victoria website. No access to the park is permitted.

A Community Meeting is planned for Sunday 29th December in Laharum, monitor VicEmergency- Grampians for specific details. 

  • The bushfire is still not yet under control, the spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. 
  • The winds are expected to be west-south-westerly during coming days.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
Recovery and Resilience 
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now. 

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan. 

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. 
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous after a fire and during high winds. 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit Better Health website.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 28/12/2024 07:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Fyans Creek, Glenisla, Laharum, Lake Lonsdale, Ledcourt, Mokepilly, Mount Dryden, Roses Gap, Wartook, Zumsteins. Issue Date: Friday 27 December 2024, 07:33 pm Next Update: Saturday 28 December 2024, 07:40 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35482/moreinfo This Advice message is being issued for Fyans Creek, Glenisla, Laharum, Lake Fyans, Lake Lonsdale, Ledcourt, Mokepilly, Mount Dryden, Roses Gap, Wartook, Zumsteins. This Advice replaces Advice issued on 27 December 2024. The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Park Victoria website. No access to the park is permitted. A Community Meeting is planned for Sunday 29th December in Laharum, monitor VicEmergency- Grampians for specific details. - The bushfire is still not yet under control, the spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. - The winds are expected to be west-south-westerly during coming days. There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Great Western, Ararat and east of Maroona and Tatyoon.
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced for the communities of Great Western, Ararat and east of Maroona and Tatyoon.

The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Park Victoria website. 

Community Meetings
Saturday 28th December
  • Moyston - at the Moyston Hall commencing at 7.30pm
  • Dunkeld - at the "Sterling Place" 14 Sterling Place, Dunkeld at 5pm
Further Community Meetings are planned for Sunday in Pomonal and Halls Gap, monitor VicEmergency-Grampians for specific details. 

This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 7.08am 27 December 2024.
 
People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area:
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
Recovery and Resilience 
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now. 

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone),and reviewing your personal emergency plan.

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Park Victoria website. Community Meetings Saturday 28th December - Moyston - at the Moyston Hall commencing at 7.30pm - Dunkeld - at the "Sterling Place" 14 Sterling Place, Dunkeld at 5pm Further Community Meetings are planned for Sunday in Pomonal and Halls Gap, monitor VicEmergency-Grampians for specific details. This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 7.08am 27 December 2024. People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Invermay, Nerrina.

  • There is a grassfire at Kiewa St, Nerrina that is under control. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • This Community Information message replaces the Advice message issued at 6:14pm on 26 December. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.


Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

cap.senderName: Department of Environment, Land, Water & Planning

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Mount Howitt Walking Track and camping area
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for the Mount Howitt Walking Track and camping area.

  • There is a bushfire near the Mount Howitt Walking Trail that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling in a south easterly direction.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • The Mount Howitt Walking Track is closed.
  • The Mount Howitt trailhead camping area and car park are closed.
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
This message was issued by Department of Environment, Land, Water & Planning.

The next update is expected by 28/12/2024 06:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bullengarook.

  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 10.07pm Thursday 26 December.
  • The bushfire at Coffeys Rd, Bullengarook is now under control.
  • Crews will continue to blackout over the weekend. 
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Listen to ABC Ballarat 107.9 FM (www.abc.net.au/ballarat) or ABC Radio Melbourne 774 AM (www.abc.net.au/melbourne).
Impacts in your area: 
  • The following roads remain closed: Coffeys Road, Carrolls Lane and Waterloo Flat Road.
  • Numerous tracks within the Wombat State Forest are closed, including Finger Point Road and several adjoining tracks.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • Firefighters will remain in the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 29/12/2024 10:10 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
